summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing the processing and uploading of records related to Jeffrey Epstein into a Relativity database for legal review. The emails mention the 'Florida investigation FOIA files' and note that due to 'events of this weekend' (likely Epstein's death on August 10, 2019), active discovery obligations have ceased, but document review continues for an ongoing investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced indirectly as 'the events of this weekend,' which led to the cessation of active discovery obligations in the legal case.

events.title: Vendor completion of PDF files
events.description: A vendor finished creating new PDF files based on 66 PDF files provided in June, related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Relativity database access and upload
events.description: Email chain confirms access to the Relativity database and instructions to upload processed Epstein records under 'Florida investigation FOIA files'.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 9-12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Legal teams were processing and uploading Epstein-related records, specifically 'Florida investigation FOIA files,' into a Relativity database for review.
Due to Epstein's death ('events of this weekend'), active discovery obligations ceased, but document review continued for an ongoing investigation.
The correspondence involves instructions for indexing documents, particularly phone bills and invoices, to improve searchability within the legal database.
The documents reference prior materials from June 2019 and anticipate overlap with a newer set of discs to be processed.
